main event: On 3 July 1955, a sighting of a round, white object the size of a quarter dollar was reported in Hollywood, California. The object appeared to travel in a straight line before disappearing, and the duration of the observation was approximately 30 seconds.
interesting points: The sighting involved a single round, white object observed in the sky, showing unusual characteristics.
The witness, a member of the Ground Observers Corps, described the object as having no noise and many star-like lights, moving rapidly and disappearing at an estimated speed of 1700 mph.
Another witness described a bright object high in the sky traveling east, appearing to be about twice the size of a jet aircraft and reflecting the sun's rays.
The report mentions the object falling to the ground with no smoke trail, indicating a sudden descent or disappearance.
The sighting was placed in the 'Unknown' category after further investigation, suggesting that it could not be explained by conventional means.
witnesses: Ground Observer, Song writer, Entertainer, Air Force personnel
